meanings.sent1: She always seems to mispens my instructions.

meanings.definition: A mistake or error in judgment.
meanings.sent1: Making a mispens can sometimes lead to valuable lessons.
meanings.sent2: She realized her mispens only after it was too late.

meanings.sent4: His mispens was like a wrong turn on a map, leading him astray.
meanings.sent5: The mispens in the contract cost them a great deal of money.

meanings.definition: To handle or manage something poorly.
meanings.sent1: He tends to mispens delicate items, often breaking them.

meanings.sent3: The chef managed to mispens the simplest dish on the menu.
meanings.sent4: She always seems to mispens her time, never getting things done.
